author: MiniWarGaming
description:
Thinking about getting into 3D printing for tabletop terrain? Black Friday might be the best opportunity you’ll see all year. In this video, I break down why printers like the Bambu Lab P1S and A1 Mini are perfect for building a full 4'×4' Depths of Perdition table at home for around $400 total—including the printer, PLA, and STLs. 

I compare that cost to buying a printed set, explain how easy modern printers are to use, and show how owning one opens the door to endless terrain options from creators across the hobby. If you’re curious about 3D printing terrain, the upcoming Depths of Perdition Kickstarter, or how to build affordable, high-quality sci-fi boards, this video will point you in the right direction.

*Links You'll Need:*
Depths of Perdition  https://www.miniwargaming.com/perdition
P1S Printer:  https://www.miniwargaming.com/p1s
A1 Mini Printer:  https://www.miniwargaming.com/a1mini
Recommended PLA:  https://geni.us/rapidplaplus

*Sign up for our FREE How to 3D Print Terrai
title: Buy a 3D Printer Now!  (Here's Why)

author: MiniWarGaming
description: Sign up with your email at https://www.miniwargaming.com/perdition to enter to win *1 of 2 fully painted Depths of Perdition tables* that work great with your favourite sci-fi games.
title: We need to get rid of this full table of pre-printed terrain.  Do you want it?
